org.svvrl.goal.core.tran.couvreur
Class ExtendedSuccessor

java.lang.Object
  org.svvrl.goal.core.tran.couvreur.Successor
      org.svvrl.goal.core.tran.couvreur.ExtendedSuccessor
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Cloneable
public class ExtendedSuccessor
extends Successor

An extended successor represents a successive state (which satisfies a set of LTL formulae), a transition to the successive state, and a set of promising formulae left to be satisfied after the successive state. Unlike Successor, this extended version may also contain previous and before formulae.

Author:
Ming-Hsien Tsai

curr - the set of formulae that hold in the current position

Method Detail

cross

public ExtendedSuccessor cross(ExtendedSuccessor succ)
Returns a successor that satisfies both requirements of this successor and another specified successor.

Parameters:
succ - a successor
Returns:
a successor that satisfies both requirements of this successor and succ, null if this object and the specified successor are not consistent

getCurrent

public LTLSet getCurrent()
Returns the formulae that hold in the current position. The returned formulae should only contain literals, previous formulae, and before formulae.

Returns:
the formulae that hold in the current position

getAll

public LTLSet getAll()
Returns all formulae except the unsatisfied promising formulae. Note that every formula in Successor.getNext() will be prefixed by a next operator.

Returns:
all formulae except the unsatisfied promising formulae

getNonLiterals

public LTLSet getNonLiterals()
